#TVDS4 should have a flashback episode set in 2006 so we can see the Salvatores' Myspace pages and Jeremy's Zune.

— price ðŸ”‡ (@pricepeterson) July 22, 2012

Breaking Bad anyone? Tonight's episode we try to figure out some stuff. Enjoy.

— Aaron Paul (@aaronpaul_8) July 22, 2012

Just in case I'm in the movies when the British Open ends, and Adam Scott wins, my headline suggestion is "Party Down Under"

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) July 22, 2012

Adam Scott might win the British Open, but Rob Lowe is the bigger name.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))ðŸ“Ž (@arrabin56) July 22, 2012

Ok, this is getting ridiculous. Tiger Woods just demanded that ESPN remove the bottom info-crawl so he can focus. #TheOpenChampionship

— Chris (@MrNoncents) July 22, 2012

Attention Golf People: You could always move the British Open to the British Virgin Islands. That is an option. The weather is nice there.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 22, 2012

There's a #MisterRogers app? There goes the neighborhood #tcas12 #PBS

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) July 22, 2012

We got to see the FIRST FOOTAGE EVER from DANIEL TIGER'S NEIGHBORHOOD. Description coming! MY REACTION IS POSITIVE. #tcas12 #pbs

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

A critic complains Daniel uses sentences that are too complex. That's what you quibble about WITH A TALKING TIGER.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

Burley Koala's Neighborhood. Of love forever.

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) July 22, 2012

"Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood" producers give me a good answer for why he doesn't wear pants. No answer for why he wears swim trunks.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

"I'll give you two reasons why Daniel doesn't wear pants. And the first is that Fred's original tiger didn't wear pants. ..." #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

"He didn't even have legs, actually. And the second is that we're sticklers for research at the Fred Rogers Company..." #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

"And we went to a number of zoos, and none of the tigers were wearing pants." #tcas12 #pbs

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

Henrietta Pussycat's reaction to new "Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood" show: "Spotlight hog meow meow no puppets meow meow." #pbs #tcas12

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 22, 2012

One of the producers is explaining the complicated backstory of Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood. I'm not making this up. #tcas12 #pbs

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

I'm all but certain that Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood is a not-so-subtle attempt to prop up the United States Postal Service. #pbs #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

Anytime you notice any issues with Daniel Tiger's wardrobe or accessories, just remember: a wizard did it. #TCAs12

— Will Harris (@NonStopPop) July 22, 2012

And now, from PBS: Ken Burns, who will bring us his documentary THE DUST BOWL. Which I fear will not be entirely upbeat. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 22, 2012

PBS Press Tour has turned into the German TV shows Liz had to watch on #30Rock. Lots of talk about futility and despair. #TCAs2012

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 22, 2012

Ken Burns' #TCAs12 address delayed by deafening applause and raucous chanting. "KEN BURNS!" "KEN BURNS!" intone the critics.

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 22, 2012

Several critics faint as Burns launches introduction to The Dust Bowl. A baby is offered up to receive a kiss from Burns. #TCAs12

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 22, 2012

A description of the dirt-swept territories detailed in the film is interrupted by a new chant. "FOUR MORE DOCS! FOUR MORE DOCS!" #TCAs12

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 22, 2012

Show me a Ken Burns film and I'll show you a handsome accompanying volume. #Merchandising #pbs #tcas12

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) July 22, 2012

Ken Burns says they've already lost 4 "Dust Bowl" subjects "to the merciless passage of time." I think that means they died. #PBS #TCAs12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

The construction of Ken Burns' sentences is so solid I believe you might be able to move into one and take up residence. #erudition #TCAs12

— Sarah Rodman (@SarahARodman) July 22, 2012

I'll bet Ken Burns swears in soft-spoken, erudite, compound-complex sentences. #pbs #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

I hope Ken Burns makes his epic TCA doc while our crotchety, wise old members are still with us. #tcas12 #pbs

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

"There was suicide as well, don't fool yourself." Egan, after Dayton Duncan talked about Dust Bowl babies dying. Bartender!

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 22, 2012

Ken Burns: "One more question." Me, in my head: "If The Dust Bowl was a flavor of ice cream, what flavor would it be?" #TCAs12

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 22, 2012

That was a roughly 90-min "Dust Bowl" panel. Captivating. ABC shouldn't plan a similar length panel for "The Neighbors." #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

Nicholas Kristof is here! (The people following #TCAs12 for Teen Choice Awards news are really confused now.) #PBS

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

#TCAs12 vs. #TCAs12 keeps turning up gold: http://t.co/m6Aycskr

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 22, 2012

Congrats to Ken Burns on his Teen Choice Award.

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) July 22, 2012

Hey, remember when America Ferrera was going to be a huge star, and then nobody could figure out how to use her? That was the worst. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

David Geffen has flown in from Sardinia to talk to us. He is definitely going to be asked something stupid. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 22, 2012

I think David Geffen is here just so someone will want to be talking to us this tour less than Aaron Sorkin. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 22, 2012

David Geffen looks like he was tricked into being here. #tcas12 #pbs

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

I would absolutely love to know what #PBS has on David Geffen that they could force him to do this #TCAs2012 panel.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 22, 2012

What's the opposite of a filibuster? That's what David Geffen is doing. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 22, 2012

This is the greatest panel ever. David Geffen isn't going to say a goddamn thing to us, and we have to LIKE IT. #tcas12 #pbs

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

#DavidGeffen dropping too many smart sound bites to keep up with on twitter #tcas12

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) July 22, 2012

If you drugged me, put me in a crate, shipped me away from Sardinia and dropped me on a TCA panel, I'd be monosyllabic, too. #geffen

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

I'd pay a large chunk of $$$ to watch David Geffen and Cloris Leachman interact in the Green Room. #pbs #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

"I don't carry a grudge for very long," Geffen says, meaning he'll have forgotten about us by the time he's back in Sardinia.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

"I wonder if critics know how much pain they inflict," Rachel Ward says in a "Pioneers of Television" clip. This could be FUN!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

Cloris Leachman literally grooming her fellow panelists. I am terrified of what she's going to do to me when I interview her after this.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 22, 2012

With a hat-tip to @ErikMAdams, it's time for #TCAs12 vs. #TCAs12 yet again. http://t.co/DxXKCkoe

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

Cloris Leachman is removing her fellow panelist's shirt. I am not even kidding. #weirdfeverdream #pbs #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 22, 2012

We're five minutes in and Cloris Leachman has gotten to second base with Bryan Brown. #pbs #tcas12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 22, 2012

"I really love The Newsroom" - Michele Lee. Hmm, might be the wrong room for that...

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 23, 2012

The thing about TCA is that it can be goofy, and then Lou Gossett starts talking about diversity on television and IT IS GREAT. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 23, 2012

I have no idea what Cloris Leachman is saying right now. Not one bit of it. But I do love "Raising Hope," so she gets a pass.
